comm: nice start. A good length delivery is swinging away outside off, Guptill gets forward and taps the ball towards point. Gentle swing, gentle pace
more swing, Not exactly full, a good length outside off. 141 kph, slightly wider. Guptill dabs the ball towards backward point
136 kph, Guptill shimmies down but has to duck for the well-directed bouncer. Looked a tad leg side, could have been a wide
nice bowling. Tight around off, no room. Guptill advances slightly but has to defend. Typical positive intent
another good delivery, good length outside off, moves away a touch. Guptill stays in his crease and defends, with bat away from the pad. Looked ungainly
maiden to start. Persists with a good length delivery outside off, pushed towards point

some swing, but too straight. Good length on Latham's pads, neatly flicked through square leg. Immediate display of these openers' contrasting techniques. Latham depending on timing and gets three, Guptill relying on power and not getting anything so far
full outside off, pushed through fuller. Guptill gets forward and skwes the ball off the outside half, gets it over and finds the gap through point. Not in control of that
better from Guptill. Fuller and wider outside off, just inside the wide line. Left alone

nice stroke. Lovely execution. A tad too full outside off, Guptill stays in his crease, but plonks his front foot forward late. Wanted to go straight over the bowler but squirts the ball over mid-off. Went way over. Hasn't found his timing, but productive
that's rubbish. Short and wide from Dhawal, Guptill sees width and throws his hands at that. Scythes his cut into the gap through extra cover. Superb shot. No problem with timing there

lovely shot. A bit too full outside off, still getting gentle away shape. Guptill strides forward and times his off drive towards mid-off and sets off immediately., something Warner has become extremely effective with. Good batting
full and straight. Hardly any swing because it was a slower delivery, pace off. Blocked
good length on middle, no room. Umesh's lines are really good. Guptill blocks it back to the bowler
shortish and wide outside off, a short delivery. Still gets some swing. Guptill sways out of the line
another good length delivery in the channel just outside off, a thick outside edge to third man for a couple.
skews it over mid-off. Mid-on is in a few metres. Full delivery on middle, keeps very low and Guptill toe-ends the ball just over mid-on. Mishy the man

not where he wanted that. Shortish on a sixth-stump channel, Guptill opens the face of his bat and looked to steer it past point or to third man. But the ball takes the face and whistles past a wide slip for four
a full, slower delivery outside off, no cut on the offcutter. Straight and so easy for an in-form Latham to caress his drive through cover. Sublime batting, but not a great ball
good length outside off, very wide, left alone
133 kph, brings the line closer to off on a length fuller than good. Latham leaves again
full outside off, nice length. The bat handle turns in his hand and he skews his drive to short cover

a plan to get Latham driving to short cover goes wrong. A tad full outside off, Latham stays in his crease, waits for the ball and just times his drive through cover. Superlative timing, finding the gap an important requisite to run-scoring and Latham checking all boxes
fullish and wide, leaves this time

smashed over mid-off. 137 kph, again looking at the toe-end of the bat. Overpitched outside off, Guptill clears his front foot and lofts the ball over mid-off. Got more than enough on that to clear the fielder. Definite low bounce
a four followed by a quick single to a deep infielder. Great batting. Not a bad delivery at all, a good length on middle, pushed to mid-on and Guptill scampers through.
loses his line. 144 kph down leg, Latham misses his flick.
great shot. Shortish and wide outside off, 141 kph. A checked cut to backward point where Pandey half-stops it with a dive to his right
another fantastic single from Guptill. really really good batting. These aren't bad deliveries. A short one, aimed at the ribs, is played down towards short leg for a quick run.
another ill-directed delivery, strays down leg. Latham misses his flick but the ball ricochets down to fine leg off the thigh pad
142 kph, a tad too full outside off, Latham doesn't quite time his drive to a diving Kohli at cover. Raucous cheers
137 kph, a misfield from Kohli. Fullish outside off, pushed to cover where an awkward bounce results in a run
signs of a slow surface. Full and wide outside off, 136 kph. Mis-timed drive is squeezed back to the bowler. Latham has been NZ's best batsman on this tour, in my opinion.
that is not a good delivery. A 137 kph half-volley outside off with no swing, sweetly timed again to a sweeper cover for a run
now goes down leg, clipped to deep square leg for one
that is a good delivery but with the confidence, Latham is equally capable to drop the ball towards point with soft hands for a quick run
back of a length outside off, tapped down towards backward point
140 kph, well bowled. Full and straight, towards off or just outside. Latham times his drive to mid-on
skewed again towards mid-on's left, Axar puts in a dive to prevent the ball from going through. Full on off from Umesh
back of a length on leg at 138 kph, pushed down towards mid-on. A loud yelp of "noo" because the fielder is quick on it

dropped. You wouldn't expect him to take that, but he certainly saved some runs. A slower delivery outside off with no change in direction in the air or off the pitch. Guptill wants to go straight but hits it to mid-kn's left off the inside half of the bat. Mishra dives to his left but parries his one-handed attempt towards long-on. Good effort
worked into the leg side, towards square leg
really impressive batting. A back of a length delivery is pushed down towards mid-off. Despite being on the back foot, Latham calls for the run and makes it easily
nicely played. Strays on the pads and worked into the gap at midwicket for a couple. Dhawal hasn't quite found his line or rhythm
pace off the ball. Slower delivery outside off, 131 kph. Punched to deep cover
back of a length on middle and leg, punched down to long-on. Dhawal needn't have that fielder back if he is bowling that length, but Dhoni's hand has been forced with the inconsistency
lovely line. Tight around off, absolutely nothing for Latham to work with. Solidly behind the line

find the gap again. Amazing batting. Can't believe he is finding the gap on so many of hos cover drives. Not full, slightly shorter but Latham gets forward and caresses his cover drive between cover and mid-off.
131 kph, fullish and wide outside off, blocked to the sweeper cover for one
full outside off, driven to cover. Can't pierce the field this time
drifts down leg, to fine leg via bat and pad
back of a length on middle, Guptill gets on top of the bounce and blocks. Good length that
a slower delivery, another one, on middle and leg. Pushed to mid-on
another slower offcutter goes down leg for a free run
what a shot. Not exactly the plan, but close enough. back of a length on middle, Guptill shimmied down and gave himself room, created space and lobbed the ball over slip with a deft deflection
shot. Poor ball, strays down leg. Guptill gets bat on his flick and gets four to fine leg.
more runs, awesome timing. Overpitched on off, Latham gets forward and times his on-drive. Gets it past mid-on. What batting
a slower ball outside off, good riposte from Pandya but Latham negates that by taping the ball to point for a quick single. Impressed with Latham's ODI transition
down leg again for another free run. Loses his line
looks for the change-up, but gets his line all wrong. The bouncer goes down leg. Pressure on India
oh my. Rubbish. Down leg again, more work for Dhoni. Wide, free runs for NZ
better comeback. 136 kph, good length on off, gets the ball to seam back in. Played down
good again. A nice length on middle, a good length. Guptill defends

superb from Guptill. Pandya is too full, too wide. Guptill opens the face of his bat and lofts the ball delectably over cover. Didn't bother keeping that down. India's seamers haven't been too good today. Too inconsistent
130 kph, almost gets through. Definite variable bounce on this surface. Good length on off, Guptill hangs on the back foot but the ball keeps low, Guptill somehow gets his bat down in time
gets some spin but the line is too straight, down leg. Latham misses his flick, falls over but keeps his feet in
flat outside off, played back
some flight and some dip on his legbreak on off, swept to deep backward square leg. Got on top of the bounce to ensure he kept that down
short, flat and wide outside off, a bit of a leading edge on his cut to point
flatter outside off, pushed through. Punched to cover
good stop, this is fuller and straight, draws Guptill forward who drives towards cover
keeps low and beats the bat of Guptill. Good bowling, clever variations in pace
nice pace, slow on off, a hint of turn. Pushed to long-on. Important that Axar slows his pace to extract some spin
drift on middle and leg, from wide of the crease. Worked to midwicket
flight and drift again on middle, "nice bowling" says Dhoni. Guptill almost gets his front foot too far across, keeps it out
fuller, straighter and pushed back
slightly short and wide outside off, cut to point.
fires it in down leg, off the pad towards square leg. Even though that wasn't a wicket-taking delivery, it isn't a bad one. Tried to protect the over
overpitched and flighted on off, driven to cover. Another dot
tossed up on off, very very slow. Crisply driven but finds cover
cover parries the drive to long-off and allows the single. Flight outside off, driven to a square cover, who half-stop it
nice use of the feet, runs down, gets to the pitch of the ball and drives to long-on
googly on middle and off, driven to long-on. Read the variation well
a bit of flight but not too full, on leg. Nudged to midwicket. Good over from Mishra
flight on off, a bit of drift. Guptill drives back to the bowler
tossed up on off, lofted past cover with a straight face, towards long-off for a couple
flat on off, defended
top-edged but gets away with that. Flat on off, Latham gets down, covers the line but some extra bounce takes the leading edge which lobs over short fine leg
very flat on off, worked towards the bowler's left. Nice stop
another good end. Shortish outside off, punched towards cover
flat but full. Guptill bends his knees and thrashes his drive to the sweeper cover. Great timing
81 ks, slow on leg, Latham comes down and pushes to long-on
beautifully bowled, slow on off, not full, not short. Guptill waits for the ball before cutting to deep point.
use of the feet again, comes down, gets there and pushes to a deep mid-off for one
great bowling, lovely variations in length. Flatter and short, hurries on. Pushed back
slow through the air outside off, ripping turn as Guptill wafts at that after bailing out from his attempted cut. Just lobs up but falls short of point
just wide of Dhawal. A better fielder would have closer. Tossed up outside off, Latham comes down and chips the ball just over mid-off

taken this time. The pressure was building on NZ. Latham tries to drag his sweep from well outside off and ends up getting a leading edge which lobs up for short fine leg to take. Axar slowed that up and pushed that wide, Latham ended up being too far outside off to control that stroke. Reward for some tight bowling
slightly short of a length, he goes back to cut it, but can't beat the man at point
driven on the up, gets a single to long-off
nicely cut away as Patel bowls flat, but the man at point is still not beaten
full and slow, 77ks, driven to long-on for a single that brings up his fifty. Muted celebration
looks to flick this full ball towards long-on, can't beat the short straight midwicket
flatter, middle and leg, pushed to short midwicket
on a length, outside off, no turn, pushed towards mid-off
non-turning flat ball outside off, pushed to cover
slows it down this time, push-driven to long-off to get off the mark
on a length, on off, straightens a little. Defended
fuller, pushed to short straight cover
Williamson jumps into an error in length. As soon as he drops short, Williamson goes back and beats point to his right with the cut
punched to deep cover for one

lovely shot. Breaking the shackles. Patel dropping short again. Not very short so Guptill goes back and plays with the vertical bat, punching him to the left of short cover and to the right of deep cover
defended to short cover
non-turning offbreak, middle and off, defended back to him

no turn again. Appeal for stumping too. Bowled from almost behind the stumps at the non-striker's end. Really slow. On a length, just outside off. Williamson looks to defend, plays for the turn, but this one almost goes away, beating the edge. Williamson's back foot drags out but comes back in time
the odd loose ball, short and quick, and he punches this towards deep cover, but a dive from Pandey inside the circle saves two runs
really slow again, and Willaimson's punch almost results in a return catch. Falls just short of Jadhav
teasingly slow and doesn't turn either. Williamson has wizened to it now, and opens the face for a single
oh slow and low. At 79ks, on the stumps, and not bouncing. Guptill gets just enough bat for a single to short fine leg
flat, shortish, cut away to deep point for one. So he now has protection for the bad ball
flat, on a length, punched to deep point
short of a length again, but lack of pace means he hits it straight to cover
driven to long-off for one
shooter. Short of a length, at the stumps, a real grubber. Williamson is watching it closely, and keeps it out
into the pads, worked into the leg side for one
punched into the leg side for one
misses out on a half-volley. There is no one protecting the boundary on the off side other than long-off, but Guptill can't beat the cover ring
well played. Straight and slow, Guptill does well to not play for the turn, and defends this back to him
Kohli saves four. Long hop, Guptill pulls this powerfully but Kohli's dive at short midwicket denies them runs
not called wide. Down the leg side, beats his sweep, but not called
flatter and quicker outside off, beats his cut with lack of turn
full, outside off, driven to long-off for one
on a length, at the stumps, punches to cover
uppish drive but the only man who can catch it is Williamson. Of course he ducks it and takes a single as the ball rolls towards long-on
short of a length, into the pads, turned around the corner for one. Dhoni gets hit on the thumb as he looks to deflect a half-volley throw
lovely lovely shot. Full, on off, there is no deep cover, and he lofts it over cover, inside out. Excellent batting
short and down the leg side, but the lack of pace means he can't time it. Gets just the single to long leg
short, wide, slow, and cut straight to extra cover. No pace to time that ball, and he struggles to find the gap
fuller, slower, straighter. Defended back

Mishra the fielder in the spotlight again. That is embarrassing. Getting lobbed on the boundary and the ball still not going for six. A hint of frustration from Guptill as he gets another short and wide delivery that doesn't come on. So he just muscles it down the ground for what seems a catch straight down long-off's throat. Mishra, though, misjudges it, runs too far in, doesn't leap or go back and watches the ball bounce inside the boundary behind him
leading edge as he looks to work this to leg. Gets a safe single
defends a straighter one
Pandya continues bowling wides. Down the leg side again
short of a length, outside off, no pace, pushed to cover
short of a length, fails to place this punch and finds cover-point
grubber, but down the leg side, and is called a wide
wide on the crease, angles a length ball in, driven on the up, straight to extra cover
lovely shot. On the up to a length ball, bisecting cover and extra cover with a drive along the ground. There are four men inside the circle on the off side, but he beats them
short of a length, on off, pushed back to him
dug in short, gets to him faster than he expects, and Guptill fails to time the pull
round arm, on a length, outside off, punched to cover
another non turner, defends the length ball back to him
Williamson has played this shooter really well. Short of a length, at the stumps, hardly leaves the ground after pitching but Williamson watches it till the end and keeps it out. Gets a single to leg
defends a length ball
fuller, driven to long-off for one
defends another low delivery to short straight midwicket

and the bowling change from spin to pace on a pitch that is assisting turn works. This is short of a length, just outside off, Guptill looks to punch it on the up but is cramped on slightly and ends up playing inside its line. The outside edge is pouched comfortably by Dhoni. A very good innings on a difficult pitch to score runs on
stays low as Taylor defends off the front foot
on a length, outside off, hard hands on the drive, is hit on the inner half. Not the kind of pitch Taylor likes
worked wide of short midwicket but Taylor has his hand up immediately. Turns down the single
wide on the crease, angling in, Taylor goes back to dab on it. Another dot
on a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
another flat short ball that stays low and doesn't turn. Played back to him with a vertical bat
keeps the bat vertical for another short ball, finds the man at cover
fuller, outside off, driven to long-off
on a length, middle and leg, driven to long-on
on a length, middle and leg, pushed past midwicket for one
full, flat, quick, pushed to short straight cover
on a length, angling in, pushed towards mid-on
lovely shot. Dhoni is looking to deny him singles, and as such the mid-off and mid-on are up. This is a little too full, and he sort of flick-drives it between mid-off and mid-on
digs this in short, and down the leg side for yet another wide
short of a length, no run, looks to tip and run, but he has made too good a connection to take that cheeky single
short of a length, outside off, placed to the left of short third man for one
short of a length, behaves like a legcutter and beats his attempt to run it to third man. Seam-up delivery
on a length, angling in, pushed wide of short midwicket for one

lovely shot. Some pace on this short ball, at 82ks, and he goes back to punch it between cover and extra cover. The short balls have been sticking into the surface and have been difficult to hit, but this one just about comes on
into the pads, worked around the corner for one
another non-turning offbreak to beat Taylor's outside edge
flatter, on off, driven to long-off for one
short, wide, filth, but the ball doesn't come on and he gets no timing or placement on the cut. Would have been called wide had he not played it
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to long-on
short of a length, angling in, defended off the back foot
wide down the leg side. His seventh today
short of a length, outside off, punched past cover for one
short of a length, stays low, but Taylor does well and plays it with the angle to get a single into the leg side
on a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
kicks at him off a length, Williamson stays watchful as his head goes back a little. Hit on the high part of the bat
that's his eighth wide down the leg side today. Dhoni has to contend with a half-volley take too. Seems to be dragging the balls down whenever he looks to bowl too fast
on a length, outside off, runs it down to third man for one
short of a length, into the pads, can't beat short midwicket
short of a length again, punched away but can't beat point
punched off the stumps, beats point, gets the single
short, long hop, but on this pitch you can't play horizontal-bat shots. Punched to long-on for one
on a length, on off, pushed to cover
shimmies down the pitch, ends up defending in front of his body, gets a leading edge that falls short of short cover
half-volley outside off, driven to long-off for one
nice and slow, dipping on him, 76ks, defended off the front foot. He has to reach for it in order to smother the turn
too full this time, driven to long-off for another single
extra revs on this, not much turn, cuts it to shirt third for a single
swept away against the turn and from outside off. Beats midwicket in the circle and there is no deep midwicket in place. All along the ground
drives down the ground but can't beat the short straight cover
on a length, outside off, hits the outside half of the bat as Taylor looks to play to cover
soft hands, and he tips and runs for a single towards cover
short of a length, at the stumps, no turn or pace, punched back to him
pulls this short ball down to long-on for one
on a length, on off, pushed back to him
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for a single. All along the ground
sharp turn, Taylor does well by playing the line and not following it with his hands. Beaten by a long distance as opposed to edging it
too full, driven to deep cover for one
wide legbreak, full too, and Williamson plays a lovely inside-out drive over extra cover. This is almost a six. Bounces just short of the boundary
quicker, flatter delivery, pushed wide of cover for one
flatter, shorter, cut to short third man. Axar is the fielder. The ball goes straight to him, but they steal the one
front of the hand, not much turn, driven to long-off for another single
flight outside off, pushed out to deep cover
tossed up outside off, too full, easy enough for Taylor to drill to long-off

short, wide and cut away down to third man. Williamson wants one, Taylor sends him back. Dhoni gets in front, but can't ricochet the ball onto the stumps. Williamson and Taylor have had running problems in the past
shortish on off, punched to long-off
flat, quick, full, straight, driven back
use of the feet, gets to the pitch and works the ball to midwicket
exaggerated turn. Flight on leg, but not full. Shortens the length to extract some purchase. Played into the off side

gone, caught behind. Quite a big edge. Shorter and wide outside off, Williamson fails to get over the bounce, gets an edge on his cut. Undone by a bit of an extra bounce, good length from Mishra. A false shot from Williamson or just beaten by the bounce, he throws his head back in disgust
flat and wide outside off, a thick outside edge played down, towards first slip
nicely bowled, lots of flight outside off, skewed to backward point
flatter trajectory on leg, shovelled into the leg side for a run
nicely bowled. Some flight, but not full enough for Neesham to smother. Blocked after reading the line
flat, quick on middle, Pushed to midwicket
short and wide, chopped towards point
lots of flight outside off, drilled to cover. Another dot.
some width on that, short and wide. Scythed away towards point, a dive prevents more runs
flatter and quicker on middle and leg, worked into the leg side for a single. Towards square leg
pushed through full and quick on off and middle, shovelled to midwicket. That bottom hand was responsible for him not finding long-on
nice, flat outside off, Neesham strides forward to defend. Wants to give himself a few balls, the right way to go
too full, too quick, straight. Neesham lofts the ball neatly over the bowler's head. All timing. Four to long-off
a bit of flight but short enough to keep Neesham prodding, nudged to square leg
big appeal. Only question is whether it pitched outside leg? Yes, it did. Good call from umpire Oxenford. Neesham misses his sweep

taken. Neesham slaps a ball to cover and falls. NZ stumbling again through the middle overs. Flatter trajectory outside off, Neesham is hesitant whether to go back or come forward. Eventually, he is in a terrible place to play the half-drive, half-cut. Excellent length. Ends up mis-timing his stroke to Kohli at cover, who dives low to his left to complete the catch. May have done some damage to his hand too. The ball may have hit Neesham twice on the bat, once at the top, then at the bottom during his swing
pushed through outside off, a nice drive to deep cover
fired in on leg, worked to midwicket
well bowled, flat and quick on middle. Not much turn, defended
flatter outside off, punched from the back foot to long-off. Great running, they get two.
just short of the bowler. Full and flat, bunted back. Almost carries to the bowler, too early into the stroke
nice end, slowed up outside off, played towards point from the crease
nicely bowled, his length has really been good. Flat down leg, spins towards off, Taylor goes back and defends
shortish and wide, chopped down to short third man
the googly on middle, Watling came forward but may have read it off the pitch. Defended
strays down leg and nudged to deep square leg for a run. The line not great, but the length still impeccable

flat outside off, patted towards backward point, Taylor looks at Watling, gets a positive response and the pair carru on for the run. The umpire calls for the third umpire, but Watling is comfortable, well in - more than a few feet
quicker down leg, nudged to deep square leg for a single
full outside off, tailing back in. Left alone. Definite reverse swing.
good single that, full on middle and leg, nicely nudged to the right of mid-on. Knew there was one immediately
rapped on the pads. Taylor shuffles across and misses his flick. Has to be aware that this ball is tailing back in. Beaten on the inside edge
and again. Full on middle and leg, swings back in prodigiously and Taylor is hit on the pad down leg.
back of a length on leg, prodigious reverse swing. Taylor inexplicably looks to play this into the off side, but takes his glove on the way to fine leg
very tight in defense as usual is Watling. Good length on middle and leg, solidly behind the line
well played, gets low and executes a fine premeditated paddle sweep to fine leg for a couple
nicely bowled, slow outside off, extracts a  bit of turn. Guided to point
a flatter delivery outside off, quicker. Thrashed to point
another dot. Shortish delivery outside off, chopped to point
good batting, flight on leg, nudged to deep midwicket, looking for two immediately but it's not there.  Nice intention
flight outside off, nicely slapped to long-off for a run
superb shot. Short, wide and that's exactly what Watling would have wanted. Chopped past backward point, to his left, and it races away
superb shot. Full on middle and leg with some reverse swing. Lovely straight drive, just past the stumps, but long-on cuts it off
back of a length outside off, cut down to third man. Mishra does well to prevent two
fullish on leg, a thick inside edge towards square leg. Good tight bowling
quick on middle and leg, shovelled towards backward square leg for a couple
143 kph reverse-swinging delivery outside off, Watling strides forward but inside edges his push into his pad.
pushed through flat on leg, worked down to fine leg for a quick run
beautifully bowled, slow outside off, a thick outside edge down to third man for a single
beautiful from Mishy. Tosses it up outside off, Taylor goes for a big cover drive but misses. Superb flight
the googly, definitely hit Taylor on the pad first, then bat. But Taylor got outside the line. A big appeal, a good decision from ump Oxenford. A run to point
hit down to long-off
end of a superb spell from Mishra, more flight outside off, Taylor strides forward and drives to cover
full on middle and leg, clipped but finds midwicket
another dot. Good length on leg, worked away to midwicket. Good tight lines from India

swung away but straight down to fine leg, and Watling goes. Fuller length down leg, Watling goes for a swing with the angle, but cannot keep it down. Cannot get enough on it. Ends up helping it down to fine leg, who had to move a few metres to his left to complete the catch.
full down leg, worked down to fine leg. Played with the angle
good length outside off, Devcich gets across and works the ball towards square leg for one
another tight over. Full outside off, pushed towards a deep mid-off, wants one, gets it.
rather full outside off, pushed back towards the bowler who misfields and concedes the run
good length, a tad leg side-ish, nudged to fine leg for one

swung away down to fine leg. Has Dhoni made the run-out again? Has he created something? Taylor was labouring back for the second, and pays the price as Dhoni collects the ball in front of the stumps and then deflects the ball back onto the stumps, all in one swift motion. Didn't even need to look at the stumps as he under-armed it back. A fantastic piece of agility, but not something new. If he was standing close to the stumps, Taylor would have made it with relative ease. Dhawal's throw from fine leg wasn't great - slow on the bounce, but Dhoni created the pace by getting to the ball
full on off, a hint of away swing. Worked past midwicket for a couple
fullish and wide outside off, a slapped scythe to deep point for one

whipped away for a couple. Nicely played. A tad too full from Dhawal, some sloppy backing-up at the non-strikers end and NZ get one more. Actually, the throw pitched and deviated away. Nothing Rahane could have done as he went to collect the throw from Axar
good length outside off, dabbed down to third man
fullish on leg, nudged to midwicket. A dot.
good length outside off, cut down to backward point for a quick single
lovely shot. Dhawal strays too straight, Santner stays in the crease, waits for the swing and then ships the ball neatly over midwicket. Didn't want to keep it down. Crucial runs
chipped into the gap at midwicket for a couple. Good batting. A slower offcutter on off, Santner clips the ball in the gap. Axar runs around from deep midwicket
an inswinging yorker, Devcich got low to paddle, but may have got some bat on that. He paddled it from outside off onto his back foot actually. Good idea, good execution, bad luck
full and wide outside off, pushed towards deep cover for a single. NZ need boundaries, not getting them with any ease
slower ball outside off, slapped to deep cover for one.
overpitched on off, Santner drills his drive to mid-off. Can't find the gap, wanted to go straighter. Just one more
well bowled.  A wide yorker outside off, Devcich misses his attempted paddle sweep

straight to cover. Another one goes. A slower ball on leg, Devcich backs away and looks to go over cover. The right option, but bad execution. The ball hardly comes on as he ends up chipping a catch to cover who takes an easy reverse-cupped catch by his shoulder
good length outside off, Santner misses his cut. Another dot
pace off the ball, slapped towards cover for one. A quick throw misses the non-strikers stumps but the backing-up is good, comes in to the 30-yard circle to stop the second
back of a length outside off, dabbed to third man
wide. Looking for the wide yorker but Santner can't reach. Called
full on off, a hint of tail away. Pushed to deep cover for two. Good running from Southee
back of a length on middle and leg, Santner bunts his mis-timed pull to deep midwicket, didn't get anywhere near enough on that
gets it over midwicket for a couple. Full on middle, the ball is coming back in. Southee skews the ball over midwicket, looked to go a lot straighter
looking for the yorker, full outside off, pushed down to mid-off. The throw misses the non-strikers stumps
a low full toss on leg, swung away down to deep square leg. Should have done a lot lot more with that.
a short delivery on leg, Santner backs away and pulls on the bounce to deep midwicket. Another single
nicely bowled. A wide yorker outside off, Southee reaches out for it, but can only tap the ball in front of point
yikes, looking for the yorker but it is wayy outside off. Almost doesn't land on the strip. Wide.
a low full toss on middle and leg, swung away to deep midwicket. Heaved for one more
a boundary to end. NZ get to 260. Rather full, straight. Southee smothers a heave through midwicket to get four. Squeezed, squirted. Off the inside half of the bat.
low bounce right away. Dug in short, the ball rises waist high, worked to leg for one
on a length, just outside off, shapes away, defended from the crease
length-ball outswinger, watchfulll played to short cover
goes wide on the crease, pitches short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
outswinger from wide on the crease. Allowed to go through to the keeper
lovely shot. Outswinger but slightly short of a length, and he punches it with an open face to find the gap between point and cover-point
swing back into Rohit, who tucks this to square leg
nice swing back in, defended off the front foot, in front of off
this one goes with the angle, and is left alone by Sharma
offcutter, short of a length, defended in front of off
full, angling away, Sharma drives, can't reach it, and is beaten. It doesn't carry to the keeper
edged but doesn't carry. Short of a length, around off, angling away, a slightly lazy push by Sharma, but it falls well short of Taylor at first slip
outswinger, not full enough to draw Rahane forward. Defended solidly
short of a length again, punched to short cover
a little straight, Rahane deflects it off the pad for a single to long leg

lovely outswinger. Sharma plays the angle as he bowls from wide on the crease. The ball pitches just outside off and leaves him to beat the tentative bat. Just not full enough to take the edge perhaps
angles this one in from wide on the crease. Is lucky that Sharma doesn't hit it. Just two leg-byes to fine leg
on the pads, worked away for an easy single
on a length, just outside off, pushed to short cover
Sharma gets going. Boult looks to dig it in short, but his line is not great. This one pitches outside leg and rises only hip high. Sharma helps it along to fine leg with a pull

cracking cut. This is short, outside off, on a slow pitch. Takes some timing to get power into such shots, but Rohit has slammed this to the right of point. Might not be easy to repeat these with the older ball
on a length, angling in, defended
pushes with an open face, to point's right, but Guptill makes a good diving save to deny them the single
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man for one

beauty from Southee. Perfect outswinger. Short of a driving length, just outside off, Sharma plays defensively from the crease. The ball moves away to take the outside edge. This is really good bowling. This is late swing, and Sharma follows it with his hands
leaves a length ball alone outside off. Watchful start
short of a length, angling in, Kohli gets inside the line, tucks it to short midwicket
wide on the crease, angling in, Kohli tucks this in front of deep square leg for two
fuller, but no swing, and Kohli pushes this wide of mid-on for a single
short of a length, angling in, Rahane looks to work it to leg but is early into the shot and is hit on the pad. Early into it
short of a length, just outside off, defended from the crease
slightly short of a length, outside off, Kohli goes back to run this to third man for one
lovely shot. Drives this length ball on the up, along the ground, and between mid-off and cover. Mid-off doesn't have too far to move to his left but is beaten
fuller, just outside off, defended
lovely drive again but this time Guptill saves four more at point. Crunchy square drive on the up but Guptill at point dives to his right to deny them runs

the first six of the match. Rahane looking good here. Boult digs this in short, the ball rises only chest high and provides Rahane width. He upper-cuts it, slightly in front of point owing to the slowness of the pitch, and sends it all the way. Boult looked for another cutter, but the ball seems too new to grip the surface just yet
short of a length, at the stumps, defended towards mid-on
a wide length ball, defended with an open face
runs this shortish delivery past wide slip for a single
good bouncer, wide on the crease, angling it in, getting it head high. Rahane shapes up to hook but decides against it. Prudently
fuller, Rahane is moving forward. No after effects of the previous bouncer. Defends solidly
on a length, around off, no swing, helped along with the angle to square leg
short of a length, angling in, Kohli opens the face and gets a single to third man
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
on a length, stump to stump, defended back to the bowler
short of a length, around off, angling away, opens the face towards wide slip. Makes sure he has played it into the ground
lovely shot. Short of a length, hip high, and Kohli punches this with vertical bat. All along the ground it goes, wide of mid-on, and the quick outfield does the rest
that was a strange shot. Short of a length, angling away to end up outside off. Kohli looks to flick it to the leg side, and is beaten. The ball seems to have done something off the pitch
on a length, outside off, moves back in to cramp him up a little. Guided to wide slip
slower ball, and now the ball has started to grip a little. Rahane early into a drive, and gets a thick inside edge onto the pad

not the most convincing boundary. There is a short cover in place, and two men behind him on the ring. Southee has bowled this slow again, and Rahane still drives, and it flies wide of short cover, and also beats the two men on the cover ring
good umpiring. rahane has walked at him and across his stumps, Southee bowls an offcutter, which turns past him and goes down the leg side. Anil Choudhry doesn't wide Southee

oh what an outfiled this is. Southee mixes up the slower ones with with a bouncer. Rahane had let one go in the last over, but he hooks this one from around shoulder high. Not too far left of Sodhi at long leg, but it keeps getting away from him
solid front-foot defensive to end the over
short of a length, middle and leg, worked to short fine leg for one
beaten. Short of a length, outside off, cross-seam, holds its line and Rahane is beaten as he looks to open the face
short of a length again, flicked off the stumps to short fine leg
fuller, slower, 124ks, Rahane hits it uppishly towards short midwicket. Falls well short
nicely driven on the up as Neesham bowls a length ball. Can't beat short cover, though
that's a wide down the leg side as Neesham angles too far
full, around off, Rahane defends to short midwicket
turn first up. Slow in the air, pitches on a length, just outside off, Kohli is beaten as he pushes at it
more turn, and this time to a flatter delivery. Kohli goes back to work this to leg
flat again, this one goes straight on, and Kohli drops this wide of short cover for a single
nice drift, Rahane stays back to open the face to a length ball. Fielded at point
slower, 85ks, pitches middle and off, and turns. Rahane defends watchfully
slightly shorter, Rahane goes back to cut it to deep point for one
another wide from Neesham down the leg side. His head falls away as he releases this
short of a length, angling in, worked away to deep square for one
short of a length, pretty straight, easy single into the leg side
short and wide, but the ball cuts back in to cramp him on the cut. Kohli calls him for a single, though, even as the ball rolls off towards the keeper off the inside half of his bat
looking for the change-up yorker. It turns out to be a low full toss, and is hit straight to short midwicket
short of a length, wide, steered away to third man
bouncer, stays a touch low, takes the bottom edge on Rahane's attempt to pull. The ball bounces through to the keeper
sharp turn. On a length, around off, and it breaks away against the angle. Kohli rooted in the crease, and is beaten
more turn but this time Kohli opens the face, uses soft hands, and gets a single fine of short third man
overpitched, driven to long-on for a single
slightly shorter than a length ball, Kohli cuts but can't beat  point
shorter this time, Kohli goes back deep into the crease and punches him down to long-on for one
Rahane gets the cut ball but he can't beat point with his shot
short to start with, concedes a single to long-on
flighted outside, driven to long-off for a single

Sodhi pitches short again, and Kohli pulls with a vertical bat, over short midwicket. Boult is really lucky with this save. He runs to to his left from deep midwicket, slides into the boundary skirting, but by the time he touches the ball the foot has left the skirting. Two runs saved

excellent shot. Sodhi still struggling to get his length right. Shortish, flat, Kohli goes back, opens the face just as the ball is about to hit Watling's gloves. Beats short third man to his left, and the outfield does the rest
and the full toss now. Kohli drives it into the covers, but can't beat Guptill at extra cover
looks to tip and run but he has hit this too hard towards cover, and is rightly sent back
inside edge saves Rahane. Short of a length, stays low as Rahane looks to whip it to leg. He is hit in front but off the thick inside edge
full, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
sharp turn as Santner slows it down again. Kohli drives at a length ball, and has had his outside edge defeated
flatter, quicker, defended to cover
calculated risk. Kohli is not going to let Santner dictate terms here. He is not close to the pitch of the length ball, but still chips it wide of long-off, and it carries all the way
short of a length, he lets it turn and works it into the leg side for a single
on a length, legbreak, punched to short cover
opens the face and takes a single straight to short third man. Rahane is alert and shouts "your end" as he realises the throw is headed to the non-striker's end
stays back to punch this to cover
no slip. Perfect legbreak, on a length, from off, takes a thick edge. Might have still gone wide of slip. Rahane gets a single to short third man
punched to long-off for one
short, stays low, can't time the pull. Played straight to short midwicket
on a length, not much turn, defended to cover
slow in the air, a touch too full, and driven to long-off for one
flirting with the lbw. Rahane goes back to pull a flat delivery, but this one skids through, making him hurry up. Gets the bat down in time
driven wide of short cover for one
short, Kohli stays back to push it to long-on for one
full, middle and leg, pushed back to Santner
legbreak on a length, outside off, misfielded by Taylor at point to allow them two runs
full toss, hammered back down the ground, between long-on and long-off. Santner runs to his right from long-off to get a dive in and save two runs
short, gives him some room, enough for him to cut it in front of deep cover for two
opens the face and takes a single after hitting it straight to short third. That man has to get faster
short. This over has had a lot of filth. Cut away for a single to deep cover
this time he makes it a proper long hop. It stays low, which is why Kohli can't time it. Gets only a single to deep midwicket
short and slightly wide outside off, worked to midwicket, who dives to his left to stop the run
worked towards square leg. Kohli wants two, Rahane is up for it, but Kohli decides against it. Excellent running
flat on middle with those drifty deliveries, pushed back
tripe. A short, nothing delivery on middle, pulled with disdain but finds deep midwicket
overpitched outside off, driven to long-off. Just too easy for these two. What can NZ do here?
a low full toss outside off, driven easily past cover for a run
nicely tossed up, draws Rahane forward who taps the ball by subtly opening the face to get the ball in front of point
overpitched outside off, hammered to cover who misfields
superb bowling, superb batting. Floaty delivery outside off, draws Rahane forward. Doesn't get as much spin, so Rahane drives with the spin to long-off
excellent delivery. Pushes this through flatter on off, not much turn. Kohli inside-edges into his pad

and gone. Kohli falls. Short and wide outside off, a terrible delivery. Kohli goes back and gets a thin edge which is well taken by Watling. Not much turn, but there may have been some extra bounce, or Kohli just played for some. Either way, what was turning into another typical Kohli chase has been cut short, almost literally.
lovely stuff, tossed up outside off, spins past the outside edge. That was a lovely over from Sodhi
flat down leg, nudged towards short fine leg for a couple
flat on leg, worked to deep square leg
fuller on off, Dhoni gets down and pushes it back
a drifty inswinger type delivery on off, Dhoni drives back to the bowler
full toss on middle, pushed to long-on
88 kph, darted in down leg, Rahane pads up and so the pair decide against running to fine leg
lovely bowling, tosses it up but it isn't full so even though Dhoni comes down, he isn't to the pitch. Good improvisation to pad-bat the ball to cover
pushed through fuller on off, slow pace. Driven to cover. Excellent pace
flatter this time, quicker, shorter, left alone
great bowling. Huge appeal, but not given from umpire Oxenford. Flight outside off, plenty of drift and then the ball rips past the outside edge. Fantastic bowling, but there was no bat there
tossed up outside off, his first overpitched delivery of the over. Drilled to cover. Maiden, two lovely overs from Sodhi
rubbish, flat down leg, pulled to deep backward square leg
more tripe. A wide, full delivery outside off, called wide
strays down leg, worked to fine leg
a yorker on off, gets it to drift in. Blocked
wayyy too wide outside off, called a wide
flat on leg, worked away towards midwicket for one
pushed through fuller and flatter outside off, bunted on the bounce to cover
another wide, yikes. A horrible over. Drifts down leg, Watling gets the ball onto the stumps via his pad
decent end. Full on off, worked to deep point for one

excellent stuff continues. Tossed up outside off, Dhoni wanted to go over cover inside-out, but the ball skews off the outside half to deep backward point. Santner gets across and puts in a run-saving dive. Good stuff from NZ
flatter on off, defended
short outside off, scythed to deep point
flight on off, Dhoni shimmies down and drills his drive back
a long-hop on off, the occasional drag-down from a legspinner, swatted to deep midwicket. Really quick bat speed
flight outside off, Rahane laces into his cut to deep point
a low full toss outside off, driven to long-on
flat on leg, Dhoni comes to the pitch and nudges to midwicket
was looking for the big muscular mow straight, but Devcich pushed this wider outside off, driven to cover
fullish outside off, easily driven to long-off

more rubbish from Devcich. A seam-up, flat and full delivery. Rahane goes back, bends his knees and dabs a powerful square drive through point. Uppish but in control of that. Fifty for Rahane, quality knock
flat on off, sits up for Rahane to punch to long-on
tossed up outside off, lovely pace. Gets some spin, left alone
89 kph, flat on off, worked with an angled bat to point. A long run, but Dhoni was unsighted as to where the ball went so decided against the run
quick on off, played into the off side
tossed up on off, some more good bowling. Played in front of cover for one
overpitched this time, too full. Hammered to long-off
87 kph, flat on middle, Rahane reads the length early, goes back and swats the ball to deep midwicket
flat on middle and leg, nudged to deep square leg
shortish and wide outside off, slapped out to cover
yes, lovely. Pushed full and still gets some spin, too full and Dhoni smothers
more spin for Santner, this time it is shorter and he gets a lot of spin. Dhoni awkwardly goes back and pushes to cover
82 ks, flight outside off, pushed to cover
quicker through the air, pushed fuller. Opens the face and guides the ball to cover. Another lovely over of spin
lovely batting. An offcutter outside off from Neesham, Rahane opens the face and dabs the ball past gully. Southee scampers across from third man and puts in a dive

given this time. The change has worked. Looked pretty close. Rahane fails to convert a solid start into a  big score, Yes, good decision by umpire Oxenford. Full and straight - towards middle and off. Rahane comes forward and shuffles across to reduce the distance from a plausible offcutter, but Neesham bowls this seam-up. It skids on and strikes Rahane in front of middle, no problem with height. Out.
full and straight, worked to midwicket
sweet timing. Too full on off, Axar gets forward and just times his on-drive through mid-on.
good length on off, solidly behind the line
well bowled, pushed through. Full on middle and leg, a thick inside edge onto the pad. A big appeal is quickly shot down by umpire Chaudhary
very intentional. Flight outside off, Dhoni slices the ball with a deft dab. Knew the gap, and found it. Races back for the second
quicker on off and middle, defended. Good bowling
another quick delivery on middle and leg, defended
short and wide outside off, sliced to point for a run
Axar gets low and paddle-sweeps to fine leg. Was looking for the hard sweep actually, got a bit of bat on that
an offcutter on leg, Dhoni misses his flick, struck on the pad, sliding down

gets through. Massive wicket. Dhoni falls. The crowd goes silent. Just a straight delivery on leg. Seam-up, Dhoni doesn't move his feet, drives at the ball but the ball finds a way through the bat and pad gap to clatter into leg stump. A big play from Neesham. May have got that to seam back in just enough.
full on off, Pandey stays leg side of the ball and pushes to cover
128 kph, pace off the ball. Offcutter, worked to midwicket
shortish and wide outside off, punched to cover for one. Pandey wanted one immediately, the cover fielder misfields anyeway
poor delivery. Strays down leg at 136 kph, a deft deflection off his legs gets Axar four to fine leg.
good length outside off, Pandey has a naughty waft at it and is beaten
good length outside off, an angled bat down to third man for one
a slower delivery outside off, pushed down to mid-off
another offcutter on off, Axar stays in his crease and dabs the ball towards point
full on off and middle, pushed to mid-on for a quick run. Good batting from Pandey
overpitched outside off, pushed towards cover
shot. Good length outside off, keeps low a touch and pulls his flat-batted swat through midwicket, finds the gap between mid-on and midwicket.
slower ball outside off, pushed to mid-off
another superb drive. Overpitched outside off, drills his drive past mid-off for four. Great batting. All timing
good length outside off, comes back in. Chopped down to third man for one
full on off and middle, skewed off the inside half past midwicket for a couple more.
fuller length outside off, pushed back
another slower delivery outside off, dabbed towards backward point where Guptill puts in a run-saving dive, diving to his left

one more. Pandey has picked out mid-on and Pandey cannot believe it. Superb catch. A slower delivery outside off, was way too full and Pandey saw an opportunity to loft the ball over mid-on. It ended up a tad too full and Pandey was unable to get underneath that. Drilled his drive, but Latham leaped up at just the right time to take a great catch with both hands well over his head. Timed his jump to perfection, had to because Pandey got plenty on it. India stumbling again

plumb in front. Jadhav has to go. An offcutter on middle, Jadhav just plain misses a straight delivery. Keeps low too. Southee takes pace off the ball, Jadhav is late on his attempted nudge and the ball raps him in front of middle. At worst, would be hitting leg stump. A double strike for NZ.
slower ball outside off, dabbed down to third man
another slower ball on off, skewed off the inside half to deep square leg for one
full and straight, great bowling. Pandya plays all around his front pad and somehow finds a gap at square leg for one. NZ all over India
Santner starts with a tossed up delivery on off, dabbed to point
flat on off, a thick inside edge towards square leg
has he got some hand on that? Flat outside off, smashed back to the non-strikers end and Santner deflects the ball unintentionally onto the stumps, but Pandya has just got back
slowed up outside off, Axar stays in his crease and defends. Lots of turn
flat on leg, worked to deep square leg
fuller outside off, pushed away towards cover
on a length, just outside off, pushed back to Boult
square drive to a slower ball, gets it past point for one. Guptill gets a bad bounce there
short of a length, pretty straight, bringing lbw and bowled into play. Defended to leg
again short of a length and on target. Pandya has to be watchful
fuller, slower ball, pushed towards mid-on for one
short of a length, no room, pushed with an open face to point
shuffles across and sweeps a really full ball for two. This is a bit of a risk but you have to take some risks now
down the wicket, nice punchy drive to long-off on the first bounce
mis-hits the slog with a deep midwicket in place, but he has mis-hit it so badly it doesn't even carry to that man
again the sweep as Santner has given him a vacant square leg region. Pandya gets a mighty top edge that clears short fine leg
flatter, quicker, honing in on the stumps, gets a thick inside edge onto the boot

oh it looks like a good shot but the fielding - both the placement and the effort - is even better. Pandya jumps out of the crease and goes inside out with the turn, but doesn't place it as wide as he would have liked. Latham is wide at long-off, and judges his run to his left perfectly to take complete this catch between where long-off and deep extra cover
bouncer, and he ducks under it
slower offcutter, middle and off, and beats his outside edge as he looks to steer it
slower short ball, this time guided away to third man for one
slower short ball again, another single to third man
slower ball, short, into the pitch, steered to third man for one
short of a length, normal pace, 134ks, runs it down to third man for a single
short of a length, Patel goes back, places it to the left of deep midwicket, but with Mishra at the wicket you won't be able to convert these into twos
and the ball goes to slip, but on the bounce as Mishra follows this legbreak with soft hands
paddle-sweeps this from outside off for a single to short fine leg

wrong'un, Patel has pulled this down, and they are claiming a catch off Patel's boot. The soft signal is out. This starts off as a filthy long hop, but Patel hasn't picked the wrong'un as he goes to pull. Luckily for him, though, this one hits his boot on half-volley before lobbing up for a take that Watling nearly drops. He finally takes it on the second attempt, but the replays show the ball clearly bounces before hitting Patel's boot
worked into the leg side and Mishra has to dive in to make what should be a regulation two
wrong'un again, full, on the pads, and worked away for a single
short, outside off, runs this down to third man
short ball, 131ks, angling in, Mishra gets inside its line and then demands a wide call. Not given because it has passed over leg stump
length ball, angling in, beats the inside edge, concedes a leg-bye
full and straight, driven hard into the pitch but Boult does well to field it overhead in his follow-through
short of a length, opens the face late, gets a single to third man. The initial call is two but it is not wide enough of third man
slower ball, accurate again, and it stays low too. Because it is at the stumps, all Mishra can do is keep it out
slower offcutter from round the wicket, Patel defends it to leg
another slower ball, Patel waits for it before cutting it, but can't get any power or placement into it

punched as Southee provides him pace, and he has timed it beautifully. Past cover it goes, Santner, the sweeper, runs to his left, covers the ball, gets the slide in, but lets it slide through. That is minus two. A rare error in the field
back to slower balls, steered to third man
full, regulation pace, 133ks, nearly a half-volley, and Mishra drives it wristily to beat mid-on to his right
slower ball again, Mishra picks it, works a length ball into the leg side for a single
down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the ball, and drives into the rather lean backside of Patel. They take a single off the deflection to long-on
wrong'un, really full outside leg, swept to short fine for one
slightly short, runs it to short third man but doesn't get the single
swept away powerfully, but they stick with one despite a fumble at deep midwicket. However, Devcich has hit the stumps direct and on a half-volley. They now get the second with the deflection
looks for a reverse sweep, gets only a faint touch, and Watling does really well to follow it and not let the ball go past him
placed wide of long-on, and this time they will come back for the second
on a length, middle and leg, driven to long-on for one
accordingly Mishra looks to make room, but ends up driving it to deep cover for one

lovely shot. Disdainful. Gets under a length ball, this is not a slower ball so he can go through the line, and lofts Neesham back over his head. Doesn't bother to run. Just stands and admires the shot
wristy flick to a length ball but hasn't been able to beat midwicket
short, no room, he cuts it, but can't beat point
slower ball, short of a length, no room, he opens the face to get a single to point

and this run-out has sent India closer to a defeat. And this run-out is not because Mishra is slow. Patel pulls and when he does so he is deep in his crease. It is pulled to the left of Santner at deep square leg. he has to get a sliding save in, which means there is an opportunity for two but because Patel gets a late start to his first run he turns down the second. Mishra is left with nowhere to go. Patel does give the second a go but the moment he sees he has to run around Boult he says no. Santner's impressive tour continues
short of a length, at the stumps, defended off the back foot
slower ball gone wrong for a wide down the leg side. Watling fails to collect this as it bounces in front of him

full, fast and that's the game. Finally through Patel. He has fought hard but it has come to an end here. Boult spears this in, Patel looks to whip it, but is late into the shot. The ball hits his pad and ricochets into the off stump
slower ball, on a length, on off, defended
full and fast, outside off, goes past his drive
slower ball, on a length, at the stumps, defended to leg
on a length, on off, slight spin, defended off the front foot
pushed wide of cover for a single
slog-swept to deep square leg
looks to sweep but Santner is slow in the air, and he gets a bottom edge towards short fine leg
wide length ball, turns away, gets the toe end of the bat for a single to short third man
looks for the big slow sweep as Santner teases him with a loopy delivery. Beaten
flighted on off, and he lofts him over mid-off for a six. The flickering flame
tossed up on off, turns away, Kulkarni stays inside the line
big wind-up, beaten just outside off as it turns across his bat
quick and flat, hurries him into the pull
flighted outside off, another big wind-up, the outside edge clears the infield
wrong'un, reads it off the pitch, goes back to work it into the leg side. Just a touch too short
lobbed up wide outside off, just a touch too wide
swept away, inside edge, gets a single to deep square
short, cut away to deep cover
yorks him, and all he can do is plays this back to Santner
slows it down, gets some bite, he opens the face to guide it to short third man
short and wide, he has dragged down the quicker ball, which has been cut away for four through point
slower through the air, a yorker too, dug out
length ball, accurate, Yadav defends for a single into the covers
short of a length, at the stumps, the fielder at point is some way in to cut the single
into the wicket again, there isn't much pace to work with, and he can only guide it to third man for a single
on a length, at the off stump, defended towards mid-off for a single
slower ball, wide down the leg side. Rare loose ball
this keeps India alive. Length ball, pitches outside off and angling further away. He slashes at it with an open face, and it flies past the diving fielder at point for four
angling in, on a length, keeps it out, but can't beat point
yes it is an offcutter first ball. Pulled away to deep square leg for one
still the slower offcutter, but not as short as the last one. Pushed to midwicket inside the circle
another offcutter. On a length, outside off, turning towards off, pushed to the left of Southee who deflects it to short straight cover
Southee bowls full pace, at 131ks, Kularkni sees it in his half, drives hard, but gets just the single to mid-off
slower short ball, offcutter too, pulled away, and gets just the single off the top half of the bat
Southee stays short and slow, pulled to deep midwicket for a single
into the wicket, short of a length, cut to third man for one
slower ball, full, driven hard, but straight to long-off. Gets just the single
short, at the stumps, he backs away to run it down to third man for one

and a big wind-up it is but the slower ball has been mis-hit straight to extra cover to level the series. Boult just too good for No. 11 with that asking rate that high. Slower, on a length, and it has been sliced
